RocketUnits Code Functions¶

rocket_units¶

RocketUnits provides a graphic user interface (GUI) for engineering units conversion.

RocketUnits provides units conversion for a number of engineering categories. Included units categories include: Acceleration, Angle, AngVelocity, Area, DeltaT, Density, ElementDensity, Energy, EnergySpec, Force, Frequency, HeatCapacity, HxCoeff, Isp, Length, Mass, MassFlow, MolecularWt, Power, Pressure, SurfaceTension, Temperature, ThermalCond, Time, Velocity, Viscosity_Dynamic, Viscosity_Kinematic, Volume, and VolumeFlow. Unit conversion can be performed either with the included GUI, or directly from python by importing the units conversion data file.

RocketUnits Copyright (C) 2020 Applied Python

rocketunits.rocket_units.add_units_to_category(c_name='', u_name='', conv_factor=1.0, offset=0.0)¶

Add conversion factor and offset for Units(u_name) to Category(c_name) Read As: 1 default unit = conv_factor u_name units

rocketunits.rocket_units.chk_units_in_category(units, category)¶

Raise an error if units are not in category

rocketunits.rocket_units.convert_string(sinp='1 atm', rtn_units='psia')¶

Given a string input, parse into float of desired units. String must be of format "number units" (at least one space) NOTE: if input is NOT a string, simply return it.

rocketunits.rocket_units.convert_value(inp_val=20.0, inp_units='degC', out_units='degK')¶

Convert inp_val from inp_units to out_units and return. :param inp_val : input value to be converted :param inp_units : units of inp_val :param out_units : desired output units :type inp_val : float :type inp_units : str :type out_units : str :return: value converted from inp_units to out_units :retype: float

rocketunits.rocket_units.create_category(c_name='', def_units='')¶

Create a Units Category and define the default units

rocketunits.rocket_units.get_category(units)¶

return the category that units belongs to.

rocketunits.rocket_units.get_degK(val, inp_units)¶

val uses input units... e.g. 25, 'degC'

rocketunits.rocket_units.get_degR(val, inp_units)¶

val uses input units... e.g. 25, 'degC'

rocketunits.rocket_units.units_in_category(u_name='', c_name='')¶

Return True if units are in category.

units_io¶

For code using fixed internal physical units, units_io facilitates the use of different units for program input and output.

units_io requires all unit input parameters to be strings of the form "value units". For example "14.7 psia" or "98.6 degF". units_io assumes that the parameter default strings hold the internal units of the parameters. Output parameters can be specified either by name, or generically as "SI", "English" or "Both".

class rocketunits.units_io.Units(meth, init_varsD)¶

For code using fixed internal physical units, units_io facilitates the use of different units for program input and output.

get_input_value(name, def_units='')¶

For inputs defined by default strings, return value in internal units

set_print_template(template='%12s = %-45s | %s')¶

Set the output string formatting template used by u_print

set_units(name='', units='')¶

Set the units of an internal parameter.

set_units_same_as(new_name, old_name)¶

Set the units of an internal parameter to the same as an existing parameter.

set_vars_dict(varsD=None)¶

Calling function or class instance will set its current locals()/vars()

u_print(name, desc='', primary_units='', added_units='', fmt='%g')¶

Print the string returned by u_string. Use output template to print variable "name" in desired units. if primary_units is input, it will be listed first in the output line. if added_units is input, it will be listed 2nd in the output line. If SI or English is different from primary_units or added_units they will be added.

u_string(name, desc='', primary_units='', added_units='', fmt='%g')¶

Return a string created by using the output template. The template shows variable "name" in desired units. if primary_units is input, it will be listed first in the output line. if added_units is input, it will be listed 2nd in the output line. If SI or English is different from primary_units or added_units they will be added.
